name: replicate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] formal to make or do something again in exactly the same way: Researchers tried many times to replicate the original experiment.
[ I or T ]
  biology, computing
  specialized If organisms and genetic or other structures replicate, they make exact copies of themselves: Chromosomes replicate before cells divide and multiply. Computer viruses replicate themselves and are passed along from user to user.

to copy or repeat something: [ T ] Researchers tried to replicate the original experiment.
biology To replicate an organism, cell, or DNA means to produce an exact copy of it. replication noun [ C ] us/ˌrep·ləˈkeɪ·ʃən/
